{"step_by_step_thinking": "Waldeyer's lymphatic ring, also known as Waldeyer's tonsillar ring, is a ringed arrangement of lymphoid organs in the pharynx. According to Document [0], the ring consists of the pharyngeal tonsil (or 'adenoid'), tubal tonsils on each side, palatine tonsils, and lingual tonsils. Therefore, the post auricular nodes are not part of Waldeyer's lymphatic ring.", "answer_choice": "D. Post auricular nodes"}
